entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Start the sync consent flow from the migration warning
entry.content:
The flow is started when the user chooses the option to sync passwords

in the password migration warning. This applies to users who are not

signed in, or are signed in, but still need to provide sync consent.

We determine whether the sync consent flow should be launched, by

first checking whether `isSyncFeatureEnabled` returns false.



Bug: 1454770, 1456777

entry.content:

I introduced this matcher in crrev.com/c/4582058. In next CLs, when

represent a row that leads to sign-in without enabling sync. So we

need to make the name slightly more generic.

entry.title: Test AccordionPattern feature flag instead of CHECK()ing it.
entry.content:
This fixes a regression from b5d1bad16cadae0a12ffc290aeff838b005fbf2a .

To address a review comment during the development of that CL, I removed

the name_ member variable. However, this particular use of name_ was

using it both to test for a non-empty name *and* to test for the feature

flag. With the new structure, these tests need to be separate.



It doesn't seem worth adding a new virtual test suite (for

AccordionPattern disabled) just to test for this bug, so I haven't added

a test.



Fixed: 1455755

entry.title: NoCopyBack: Do no use Location() in LayoutSVGRoot
entry.content:
This is a preparation to remove LayoutBox::Location().



This CL updates LayoutSVGRoot::PositionForPoint() and

LocalToSVGParentTransform() so that they use PhysicalLocation()

instead of Location(). This might change the behavior in the

vertical-rl writing-mode, but we didn't find test cases showing such

changes.



This change is guarded by 'LayoutNGNoLocation' flag.

entry.title: Revert "[Fixit] Fix memory leak in FeedStream"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 143a46965cd0bdc5118a519ca31f63980f535825.



Reason for revert: Suspect to cause a crash: https://crbug.com/1456626



Original change's description:

> [Fixit] Fix memory leak in FeedStream

>

> As part of deflaking:

> TabSwitcherAndStartSurfaceLayoutTest#testActivityCanBeGarbageCollectedAfterFinished

>

> I've identified one of the causes of the leaked activity is that

> FeedStream's native counterpart holds a reference to it and is

> never deleted. This CL fixes that issue. Although others

> remain.

entry.title: win: Don't block shutdown migrating taskbar pins
entry.content:
Migrating taskbar pins can be time consuming if there are a lot of

pinned Chrome and/or PWA icons. On some bots, it's causing timeouts.

Similarly, it seems that we don't want to block the browser shutdown

(basically, starting up and closing Chrome quickly) either.

entry.title: Fix handling of the "Guest mode" link
entry.content:
This CL fixes the issue where Ctrl/Shift+clicks on a special link in the

"Add Google Account" setting dialog open an Ash browser even in

LacrosOnly, by disabling the default navigation in the click-handler.



Also, this CL hides the "Open link in ..." context menu items on

"button-like" links (i.e links that have a href="#") if the browser is

for a SWA or a SystemWebDialog since displaying those items makes little

sense considering the intention of those links is not actual navigation

but triggering a click-handler defined in JavaScript.

entry.title: [PolicyLogs] Replacing Sequence Checks and Posting Tasks by Lock
entry.content:
There have been several related sequence related issues from tests

trying to add logs. e.g. crrev.com/c/4616067 and crrev.com/c/4559846.

To overcome these issues, and prevent them from happening again in the

future, a lock has been chosen as the preferred method for preventing

race conditions on the logger.



To avoid manipulations on a vector with unbounded size, old logs are

deleted whenever the vector size exceeds 200. Currently, the vector

size stays around 30.



The CL also enables adding logs on desktop.





Bug: b/282733597

entry.title: iOS: Emit Supervised User Interstitial commands from JS
entry.content:
Introduce a new ios listener (`SupervisedUserInterstitialJavaScriptFeature`) for JS

messages emitted from the supervised user interistial.

These messages (commands) are the passed to the

Supervised User Interstitial instance through the

Supervised User Error Container bound to a given

WebState.



An upcoming CL will instantiate the SU Interstitial and

have it execute the received commands.

entry.title: [omnibox] Removes accessors to unowned instances in OmniboxEditModel
entry.content:
This change addresses some long standing TODOs by de-spaghettifying

the Omnibox UI classes and making the structure more tenable by

removing accessors to the ACController, ACResult, and OmniboxClient in

the OmniboxEditModel.



These instances are owned by OmniboxController. Since OmniboxController

owns the OmniboxEditModel, any existing or future consumer of those

instances should technically be able to access them directly via

OmniboxController, if they are able to access them via OmniboxEditModel.



Also rather than passing OmniboxEditModel to OmniboxResultView,

OmniboxRowView, and OmniboxSuggestionButtonRowView, this change also

adds convenience accessors for OmniboxController and OmniboxEditModel

to OmniboxPopupView base class to be used in its implementations and

their child views.



Low-Coverage-Reason: making a mechanical change.



Bug: 1404748

entry.title: Include AllocationStackTraceRecorder into Crashpad report - 4/N
entry.content:
With Arm's Memory Tagging Extension enabled, a process shall receive a

SIGSEGV if it encounters a mismatch in memory tags. To help developers

analyse problems like this, we want to include a history of the most

recent allocations and frees in the crashpad report.



This CL introduces proper unit testing for the

AllocationRecorderHolder, there are no changes in production code.



Bug: 1137393

Change-Id: I948e9ab63662e320d48b6416bc45be2c43783fa4

entry.title: Treat component failures leniently in @font-face src: parsing
entry.content:
Adapt font-face src: parsing behavior to more leniently accept a src:

line that has parse errors in an individual component. Part of Interop

2023 in the font feature detection and palettes category [1].



Also return serialized values in lowercase to match CSSOM spec.



After CSS WG resolution [1] and updated spec text [2] individually

failing src: line components for incorrect format() or tech(), or other

parse failures per component should not lead to dropping the whole src:

line, but only reject the individual component.



Implement checks for component sanity and on failure, skip to next comma

or end.



Test updates:

* fast/css/font-face-src-parsing.html updated to account for more cases

being allowed. For example, trailing commas in a src: line are not a

full parse failure.

* fast/css/font-face-unquoted-local.html removed. The test is too

restrictive after the behavior change, and relatively trivial and

already covered in WPT tests, for example

font-format-src-parsing.html.

* fast/css/fontfaceset-multiple-families.html updated to account for a

@font-face with format("svg") being rejected early and thus not

becoming part of the FontFaceSet of the page.

* external/wpt/css/css-fonts/format-specifiers-variations.html disabled

until review in https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/40666

is complete. Test seems to be expecting an incorrect error type,

NetworkError vs. SyntaxError.



[1] https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-fonts/parsing?q=label%3Ainterop-2023-fonts

[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6340

[2] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-fonts-4/#font-face-src-parsing



Fixed: 1398933, 857226

Change-Id: Ib94f745fb8b453e21fd981973c29dccb4b722439

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4624052

entry.title: Enable ProxyTabs in transport mode
entry.content:
...if kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is enabled.



ProxyTabs is a "proxy" data type, meaning it doesn't actually have any

data attached to it. However, its state (enabled or not) gets plumbed

to SessionSyncService (which uses it to determine whether to expose

the OpenTabsUIDelegate, i.e. tabs from other devices), and is also

exposed in the sync protocol itself.



Bug: 1448887

entry.title: Enable the static routing API via OriginTrial token
entry.content:
This CL enables the static routing API in ServiceWorker via Origin Trial

token. SeriviceWorker stores OriginTrial tokens on its database and

this CL look into that.



This CL changes |router_evaluator| being set only when the feature is

enabled by the feature flag or OriginTrial token. This change simplifies

the feature detection in both main resource and subresource because the

only thing we have to check is |router_evaluator|.

entry.title: [Android][CredMan] Allow Filler to be reusable
entry.content:
Unlike TTF, CredMan UI can be retriggered via KA reentry point.

However, the filler had the assumption that only a single call to

KeyboardReplacingSurfaceClosed or FillSuggestion is possible.



This CL moves this responsibility up to TTF. Now the driver is never

cleaned from the filler but the filler is reset when the TTF is

dismissed.



Bug: 1434278

calls into prefetch_test_utils helpers, to make

entry.title: Cosmetic fix on chrome://serviceworker-internals.
entry.content:
- "Static router rules:" won't be shown if the rules are not set.

i.e. "Static router rules: undefined" won't be shown any more.



- Show the rules even if the service worker is not running.

In addition to get the data from ServiceWorkerVersion, it is also got

from registaration in case ServiceWorkerVersion instance does not

exist e.g. ServiceWorker has not been started yet.

entry.title: [viz] Use multiplane in mailbox creation in FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl
entry.content:
This CL changes FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl to pass the NV12_MULTIPLANE

format to CopyOutputRequest() when multiplane SharedImages are enabled

in the case where mailboxes will need to be created (i.e., there is no

blit request). This is possible now that CopyOutputNV12() supports

NV12_MULTIPLANE in this code path.



NOTE: As far as we know this codepath is not yet used in production, so

we don't expect any fallout from this change.



Bug: 1455074

entry.content:

bytes is modified.

entry.title: [rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust on Fuchsia
entry.content:
This enables the first bytes of Rust in the Chromium binary itself

for Fuchsia. It simply enables a chrome://crash/rust URI handler

which users should not normally encounter.



We're enabling this carefully and progressively across platforms -

Fuchsia is next as there are no known blockers.

several files. In case this template is transparently modified in

parameter with a default value, these declaration would result in

compiler errors.

entry.title: Optimise URLLoaderFactory::UpdateLoadInfo
entry.content:
network::URLLoaderFactory::UpdateLoadInfo() is a hot function in

profiles of the network process. Restructure it a bit to reduce the

amount of work it does:



1. Call URLLoader::CreateLoadInfo() only for the most interesting url

loader. A new method, URLLoader::PartialLoadInfo() returns just the

info needed to choose the most interesting loader.

2. Call URLLoader::GetLoadState() only once for each url loader. This is

a hot function.



BUG=1276591



Change-Id: Ice845484def563ae4ef02c6e77410e07687f6175

entry.title: Revert "CrOS Settings: Clearing pref when UMA consent is revoked."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 72dd2841ebe8b65f1c46fb417866539138517ddb.



Reason for revert: Failed CHECK() for GAIA test accounts b/288018127



Original change's description:

> CrOS Settings: Clearing pref when UMA consent is revoked.

>

> Clearing the kTotalUniqueOsSettingsChanged pref when the user has

> revoked consent for UMA. We will not store the unique Settings, and we

> will not record data to the histograms.

> If the user grants consent for UMA, we will keep the state that the user

> has revoked consent before and we will not record their data in the

> histogram

> ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime.{time}.

> We will not record the data again once the user has granted consent

> to increase the accuracy of the data that we are recording.

>

> dd: go/cros-settings-revamp-metrics-design-doc

>

> NOTE: This CL will have a follow-up that will convert the

> unittests per_session_settings_user_action_tracker_unittest.cc and

> settings_user_action_tracker_unittest.cc to browser tests. They need

> to get converted as we are now using g_browser_process in

> PerSessionSettingsUserActionTracker which can only be tested using

> browser tests.

>

> Bug= b/285021579

> TEST=

> Manual:

> All tests must be taken with a user that has run OOBE.

>

> Histograms:

> ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime.{time}

> {time} = one of {FirstWeek, SubsequentWeeks, Total}

> {time} is based on the time passed since the user has taken

> OOBE, .FirstWeek and .SubsequentWeeks. The total of first and

> subsequent weeks will be recorded in .Total histogram.

> A) Open Settings, grant UMA consent. Histogram will record

> the data if any.

> B) Open Settings, revoke UMA consent. Histogram will no

> longer record the data, until the user grants UMA consent again.

> C) Open Settings, grant UMA consent again. Case B will repeat again

> since we will not record data if the user has revoked their consent at

> least once in the lifetime of the device.

>

> Automated: Unittest: DISPLAY=:20 out/Default/unit_tests

> --gtest_filter="*SettingsUserActionTrackerTest*"

>

> Change-Id: Ie973044ab375082d2e5272da4ce26b6f858ae08d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4574214

> Reviewed-by: Xiaohui Chen

> Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia

> Commit-Queue: Nikki Moteva

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1159212}

entry.title: Include driver version number in Windows GetPrinterDriverInfo()
entry.content:
The Windows version of GetPrinterDriverInfo() has been collecting the

product version as part of the info. This string is representative of

a Windows printing support classes version, but this is not the version

of the driver provided by printer manufacturers.



The printer driver info is built up of four entries. The product

version entry is actually a substring within the file version entry,

so that field can be recycled without losing information or affecting

crash_keys::ScopedPrinterInfo.



Use the OEM printer driver version instead as one of the info entries.

Reorder the entries so that the OEM fields are together at the start,

and the operating system entries are at the end.

entry.title: Revert "Check reportEvent() destination for enrollment/attestation."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4a964f37d14d5b45485dfa1050be4baef108f997.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8777709748654697105



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8777709748654697105



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8777709748654697105&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4594658



Original change's description:

> Check reportEvent() destination for enrollment/attestation.

>

> Sites must be enrolled in order to use Privacy Sandbox APIs. This CL

> adds a check for event reporting (both through reportEvent() and through

> automatic beacons) that only lets an event get sent out if the site is

> enrolled.

>

> In order for the fenced frame reporter to perform the check, it needs

> access to the browser context. The context is plumbed through the code

> paths that create the FencedFrameReporter object and stored for later

> use. As a side effect, we no longer need to plumb the AttributionManager

> into the FencedFrameReporter, as we can just get it directly from the

> newly plumbed BrowserContext.

>

> This CL also makes changes so that the check will always return true

> when running in all web tests and in certain browser/unit tests.

>

entry.title: NoCopyBack: LocalCaretRect() returns no block-flipped rectangle.
entry.content:
This is a preparation to remove LayoutBox::Location().



The existing LayoutBox::LocalCaretRect() uses a LayoutRect with a

block-flipped physical location and logical size, then returns a

block-flipped physical rectangle. It's very confusing.



This CL adds new implementation of LocalCaretRect() with a PhysicalRect.

It doesn't return block-flipped rectangle.

Also this CL renames the existing one to FlippedLocalCaretRect().

entry.title: Check reportEvent() destination for enrollment/attestation.
entry.content:
Sites must be enrolled in order to use Privacy Sandbox APIs. This CL

adds a check for event reporting (both through reportEvent() and through

automatic beacons) that only lets an event get sent out if the site is

enrolled.



In order for the fenced frame reporter to perform the check, it needs

access to the browser context. The context is plumbed through the code

paths that create the FencedFrameReporter object and stored for later

use. As a side effect, we no longer need to plumb the AttributionManager

into the FencedFrameReporter, as we can just get it directly from the

newly plumbed BrowserContext.



This CL also makes changes so that the check will always return true

when running in all web tests and in certain browser/unit tests.



Change-Id: I1eca7742c99c81c27c5940fc86b0bef46e2e2711

entry.title: Move ownership of PrefetchResponseReader to PrefetchContainer
entry.content:
This CL makes `PrefetchResponseReader` owned by

`PrefetchContainer::streaming_loaders_` instead of

`PrefetchStreamingURLLoader`, and thus decouples the

ownership/lifetime of `PrefetchResponseReader` from

`PrefetchStreamingURLLoader`.



After start serving, `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` and

`PrefetchResponseReader` are self owned and kept alive by

prefetching-side and serving-side mojo channels, respectively.

`PrefetchResponseReader` doesn't keep alive its `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader`, because after the prefetching

URLLoader is finished all the data needed for serving is

stored in `PrefetchResponseReader`.



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/133Xwdh0sEnODHHOdt5QMdFMdfanTJ01UecCupjOjdZo/edit#heading=h.6cyajgj47dx

(Implementation Design (Phase 1) section)



Bug: 1449360

Change-Id: I2d8063208bca092011b03ab0c9c46e6c418a50ea

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4611970
